text: Harold Brown (September 14, 1920 â€“ January 12, 1997) was a former Canadian ice hockey right winger. He played in the National Hockey League for the New York Rangers. He was born in Brandon, Manitoba. Brown served in World War II with the Royal Canadian Navy. He died at his home in Calgary, Alberta in 1997."Obituaries", The Calgary Herald, January 16, 1997, C13 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1920 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Canadian military personnel of World War II Category:Ice hockey people from Brandon, Manitoba Category:New York Rangers players
title: Harold Brown
